name: Costello Syndrome
description: Costello syndrome is a rare genetic disorder characterized by developmental delays, intellectual disability, distinctive facial features, cardiac abnormalities, skin and musculoskeletal problems, and an increased risk of certain cancers. It is caused by mutations in the HRAS gene, which plays a role in cell growth and division.
prevalence: Estimated 1 in 300,000 to 1 in 1,250,000 live births
symptoms: Distinctive facial features (coarse face, full lips, large mouth)
prognosis: Variable; depends on the severity of cardiac issues, tumor development, and other complications. Lifelong monitoring and management are required.
lifeExpectancy: Reduced; influenced by cardiac complications and cancer risk. Some individuals live into adulthood with appropriate management.

treatmentOptions.name: Surgical Intervention (for cardiac defects or papillomata)

eli5Summary: Costello Syndrome is a rare problem kids are born with. It makes them look a little different, learn slower, and sometimes have heart problems. Doctors help them grow and stay healthy.
clinicalSummary: Costello syndrome is a rare RASopathy caused by heterozygous mutations in the HRAS gene. The syndrome is characterized by distinctive facial features, cardiac abnormalities (particularly hypertrophic cardiomyopathy), cutaneous papillomata, musculoskeletal abnormalities, neurocognitive delays, and an increased predisposition to certain malignancies, notably rhabdomyosarcoma and neuroblastoma. Diagnosis is typically made clinically and confirmed by genetic testing. Management involves multidisciplinary care, including cardiology, dermatology, developmental pediatrics, and oncology. Surveillance for tumor development is crucial. Prognosis varies depending on the severity of cardiac and oncologic complications.
historicalBackground: Costello syndrome was first described by Dr. John Costello in 1977. The genetic basis of the syndrome, mutations in the HRAS gene, was identified in 2004.

recentBreakthroughs.title: Identification of Novel HRAS Mutation Modifiers
recentBreakthroughs.description: Research has identified genetic modifiers that influence the severity of Costello syndrome phenotypes, offering potential targets for future therapies.

recentBreakthroughs.title: Improved Cardiac Management Strategies
recentBreakthroughs.description: Advances in cardiac imaging and medical management have improved outcomes for individuals with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy associated with Costello syndrome.
